title: Messaging and calls
content:
# WhatsApp App Guide

## Navigation
- **Bottom Navigation Bar**: Switch between **Chats** (main inbox), **Updates** (Status & Channels), **Communities** (groups organization), and **Calls** (history).
- **Camera Tab**: Tap the **Camera icon** (top left or bottom nav) to quickly take a photo or video for Status or chats.
- **Menu**: Access **Settings**, **Linked Devices**, and **New Group** via the **Three-dot menu** in the top-right corner.

## Search
- **Search Bar**: Tap the **Magnifying Glass icon** (top right) to search for messages, contacts, media, or links within your chats.
- **Meta AI**: Look for the **multicolored circle icon** (often above the new chat button or in the search bar) to chat with the AI assistant.

## Common Actions
- **New Chat**: Tap the green **Plus (+)** or **Message icon** (bottom right) to start a conversation or select a contact.
- **Post Status**: Go to the **Updates** tab and tap **My Status** (or the pencil/camera icons) to share text, photos, or voice updates.
- **Link Device**: To use WhatsApp on a computer, open the Three-dot menu → **Linked devices** → **Link a device**.
- **Make a Call**: In the **Calls** tab, tap the **Phone+ icon** to start a voice or video call.

## Tips
- **Pin Chats**: Long-press a chat and tap the **Pin icon** at the top to keep it permanently at the top of your list (up to 3 chats).
- **Starred Messages**: Long-press a specific message inside a chat and tap the **Star icon** to save it for quick access later.
- **Disappearing Messages**: Tap a contact's name at the top of a chat to enable **Disappearing messages** (24 hours, 7 days, or 90 days).
- **Privacy Checkup**: Go to Settings → Privacy to run a **Privacy Checkup** and manage who can see your online status or profile photo.
